intro: Agrimonia eupatoria var. subconnivens, commonly known as lesser agrimony, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in compact, spherical clusters called cymes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with serrated edges and a rough texture. The plant is often found in dry meadows, woodland edges, and rocky soils, and has been historically used in traditional herbal medicine.
